result.execSummary:
The defendant David B Menden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs for Count 3 shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision in Count 1.  Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time.  

Defendant shall partake in vocational training as requested by the agent.

Defendant shall not possess any weapons.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall not possess any drug parapheranlia.

Defendant shall not associate with any drug dealers or users.

Defendant shall not be present where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Defendant shall have no contact with Jason M. or After Hours Lingerie and Gifts.

Contact with Michelle A. as per the agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, programming and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Defendant shall make monthly payments toward court obligations and pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Costs of Count 3 shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision in Count 1.

Per court 9-19-14 include credit time on Count 3 of 109 days as sentence is concurrent to Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.addlTxt: Probation discharged.

State rqst. cash bond of at least $5,000.00 and there may be additional charges may be forthcoming in the Br. 4 case-14CM407.  Atty. Mayer rqst. $250-500.00 cash bond.
